item.title: Israel and Hamas' ceasefire appears to hold after Gaza hostage and detainee exchanges
item.description: The tenuous ceasefire in the two-year Israel-Hamas war appears to be holding even as complex issues remained ahead.

item.title: What's next for Gaza. And, ICE tactics are reportedly becoming more violent
item.description: With the first phase of a ceasefire holding, eyes are on what is next for Gaza. And, ICE agents are ramping up arrest operations in several cities and raising concerns about their tactics.

item.title: Opinion: Why I'm handing in my Pentagon press pass
item.description: Tom Bowman has held his Pentagon press pass for 28 years. He says the Pentagon's new media policy makes it impossible to be a journalist, which means finding out what's really going on behind the scenes and not accepting wholesale what any government or administration says.

item.title: In reading, the nation's students are still stuck in a pandemic slump
item.description: New 2025 testing data shows third- through eighth-graders scored far below 2019 levels in reading. In math, some grades have made gains, but all are lagging compared to before the pandemic.

item.title: Death toll from torrential rains in Mexico rises to 64 as search expands
item.description: Mexico has deployed some 10,000 troops in addition to civilian rescue teams. Helicopters have ferried food and water to the 200 some communities that remained cut off by ground.
